packages.name: io
packages.description:
## Module Overview

This module is designed to support input and output operations via channels in a canonical way, either in a blocking,
or non-blocking manner.

![architecture](./resources/package-architecture.svg)

### Channels
A channel represents an I/O source or sink of some bytes, characters, or records that are opened for reading or
writing respectively.

### Byte channels
The most primitive channel is the `ByteChannel` which reads and writes 8-bit bytes. For an example on the `ByteChannel`, see the [Byte I/O Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/byte-io.html).

### Character channels
The `CharacterChannel` is used to read and write characters. The charset encoding is specified when creating the `CharacterChannel`. For an example on the `CharacterChannel`, see the [Read/Write Files Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/character-io.html).

If a `ReadableCharacterChannel` points to a JSON or XML source, it can be read and then written directly into a variable of
the respective type. For examples on reading/writing JSON or XML sources, see the [JSON I/O Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/json-io.html) and [XML I/O Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/xml-io.html).

### Record channels

Also, Ballerina supports I/O for delimited records. For an example on reading the records in a text file, see the [Record I/O Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/record-io.html).

A `.CSV` file can be read and written directly into a `CSVChannel` as shown in this [CSV I/O Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/csv-io.html).

### Data Channels
Ballerina supports performing data i/o operations.

A Person object could be serialized into a file or a network socket as seen in the [Data I/O Example](https://ballerina.io/swan-lake/learn/by-example/data-io.html).
packages.summary:
This module is designed to support input and output operations via channels in a canonical way, either in a blocking,
or non-blocking manner.

parameters.name: readableByteChannel
parameters.description: The `io:ReadableByteChannel` that this block stream is referred to

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: The size of a block as an integer

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initialize a `BlockStream` using a `io:ReadableByteChannel`.

returnParameters.description: Returns a `io:Block` when a block is avaliable in the stream or return null when the stream reaches the end

methods.name: next
methods.description: The next function reads and return the next block of the related stream.

returnParameters.description: Returns null when the closing was successful or an `io:Error`

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Close the stream. The primary usage of this function is to close the stream without reaching the end.
If the stream reaches the end, the `blockStream.next()` will automatically close the stream.

parameters.name: readableByteChannel
parameters.description: The `io:ReadableByteChannel` that this block stream is referred to

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: The size of a block as an integer

returnParameters.description: Returns a `io:Block` when a block is avaliable in the stream or return null when the stream reaches the end

otherMethods.description: The next function reads and return the next block of the related stream.

returnParameters.description: Returns null when the closing was successful or an `io:Error`

otherMethods.name: close
otherMethods.description:
Close the stream. The primary usage of this function is to close the stream without reaching the end.
If the stream reaches the end, the `blockStream.next()` will automatically close the stream.

classes.name: BlockStream
classes.description:
`BlockStream` used to initialize a stream of type `io:Block`. This `BlockStream` refers to the stream that embedded to
the I/O byte channels.

parameters.name: readableTextRecordChannel
parameters.description: The `io:ReadableTextRecordChannel` that this CSV stream is referred to

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initialize a `CSVStream` using a `io:ReadableTextRecordChannel`.

returnParameters.description:
Returns a CSV record as a string array when a record is avaliable in the stream or
return null when the stream reaches the end

methods.description: The next function reads and return the next CSV record of the related stream.

returnParameters.description: Returns null when the closing was successful or an `io:Error`

If the stream reaches the end, the `csvStream.next()` will automatically close the stream.

classes.name: CSVStream
classes.description:
`LineStream` used to initialize a stream of type strings(lines). This `LineStream` refers to the stream that embedded to
the I/O record channels.

parameters.name: readableCharacterChannel
parameters.description: The `io:ReadableCharacterChannel` that this line stream is referred to

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initialize a `LineStream` using a `io:ReadableCharacterChannel`.

returnParameters.description: Returns a line as a string when a line is avaliable in the stream or return null when the stream reaches the end

methods.name: next
methods.description: The next function reads and return the next line of the related stream.

returnParameters.description: Returns null when the closing was successful or an `io:Error`

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Close the stream. The primary usage of this function is to close the stream without reaching the end.
If the stream reaches the end, the `lineStream.next()` will automatically close the stream.

returnParameters.description: Returns a line as a string when a line is avaliable in the stream or return null when the stream reaches the end

classes.name: LineStream
classes.description:
`LineStream` used to initialize a stream of type strings(lines). This `LineStream` refers to the stream that embedded to
the I/O character channels.

parameters.name: nBytes
parameters.description: A positive integer. Represents the number of bytes, which should be read

returnParameters.description: Content (the number of bytes) read, an `EofError` once the channel reaches the end or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: read
methods.description:
Source bytes from a given input resource.
This operation will be asynchronous in which the total number of required bytes might not be returned at a given
time. An `io:EofError` will return once the channel reaches the end.
```ballerina
    # byte[]|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.read(1000);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Either a read only `byte` array or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: readAll
methods.description:
Read all content of the channel as a `byte` array and return a read only `byte` array.
```ballerina
    # byte[]|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.readAll();
    # ```

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: A positive integer. Size of the block.

returnParameters.description: Either a block stream or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: blockStream
methods.description:
Return a block stream that can be used to read all `byte` blocks as a stream.
```ballerina
    # stream<io:Block, io:Error?>|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.blockStream();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: An encoded `ReadableByteChannel` or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: base64Encode
methods.description:
Encodes a given `ReadableByteChannel` using the Base64 encoding scheme.
```ballerina
    # io:ReadableByteChannel|Error encodedChannel = readableByteChannel.base64Encode();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: A decoded `ReadableByteChannel` or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: base64Decode
methods.description:
Decodes a given Base64 encoded `io:ReadableByteChannel`.
```ballerina
    # io:ReadableByteChannel|Error encodedChannel = readableByteChannel.base64Decode();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Will return `()` if there is no error

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given `ReadableByteChannel`.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = readableByteChannel.close();
    # ```

parameters.name: nBytes
parameters.description: A positive integer. Represents the number of bytes, which should be read

returnParameters.description: Content (the number of bytes) read, an `EofError` once the channel reaches the end or else an `io:Error`

classes.name: ReadableByteChannel
classes.description:
ReadableByteChannel represents an input resource (i.e file). which could be used to source bytes.
A file path or an in-memory `byte` array can be used to obtain a `io:ReadableByteChannel`.
A `io:ReadableByteChannel` do not support initilization, and it should be obtained using the following methods or implement natively.
`io:openReadableFile("./files/sample.txt")` - used to obtain a `io:ReadableByteChannel` from a given file path
`io:createReadableChannel(byteArray)` - used to obtain a `io:ReadableByteChannel` from a given `byte` array

parameters.name: byteChannel
parameters.description: The `ReadableByteChannel`, which would be used to read the characters

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The character set, which would be used to encode/decode the given bytes to characters

methods.name: init
methods.description: Constructs a `ReadableCharacterChannel` from a given `ReadableByteChannel` and `Charset`.

parameters.name: numberOfChars
parameters.description: Number of characters, which should be read

returnParameters.description: Content, which is read, an `EofError` once the channel reaches the end or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: read
methods.description:
Reads a given number of characters. This will attempt to read up to the `numberOfChars` characters of the channel.
An `io:EofError` will return once the channel reaches the end.
```ballerina
    # string|io:Error result = readableCharChannel.read(1000);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Either a string or `io:Error`

methods.name: readString
methods.description:
Read the entire channel content as a string.
```ballerina
    # string|io:Error content = readableCharChannel.readString();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Either a string array or `io:Error`

methods.name: readAllLines
methods.description:
Read the entire channel content as a list of lines.
```ballerina
    # string[]|io:Error content = readableCharChannel.readAllLines();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The read JSON string or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: readJson
methods.description:
Reads a JSON from the given channel.
```ballerina
    # json|io:Error result = readableCharChannel.readJson();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The read XML or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: readXml
methods.description:
Reads an XML from the given channel.
```ballerina
    # json|io:Error result = readableCharChannel.readXml();
    # ```

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: The property key needs to read.

parameters.name: defaultValue
parameters.description: Default value to be return.

returnParameters.description: The read property value or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: readProperty
methods.description:
Reads a property from a .properties file with a default value.
```ballerina
    # string|io:Error result = readableCharChannel.readProperty(key, defaultValue);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Either a stream of strings(lines) or an io:Error.

methods.name: lineStream
methods.description:
Return a stream of lines that can be used to read all the lines in a file as a stream.
```ballerina
    # stream<string, io:Error?>|io:Error? result = readableCharChannel.lineStream();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: A map that contains all properties

methods.name: readAllProperties
methods.description:
Reads all properties from a .properties file.
```ballerina
    # map<string>|io:Error result = readableCharChannel.readAllProperties();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: If an error occurred while writing

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given character channel.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = readableCharChannel.close();
    # ```

parameters.name: byteChannel
parameters.description: The `ReadableByteChannel`, which would be used to read the characters

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The character set, which would be used to encode/decode the given bytes to characters

initMethod.description: Constructs a `ReadableCharacterChannel` from a given `ReadableByteChannel` and `Charset`.

classes.name: ReadableCharacterChannel
classes.description: Represents a channel, which could be used to read characters through a given ReadableByteChannel.

parameters.name: byteChannel
parameters.description: The CharacterChannel, which will represent the content in the CSV file

parameters.name: fs
parameters.description: Field separator, which will separate between the records in the CSV file

parameters.name: nHeaders
parameters.description: Number of headers, which should be skipped prior to reading records

methods.name: init
methods.description: Constructs a CSV channel from a CharacterChannel to read/write CSV records.

returnParameters.description: True if there's a record

methods.name: hasNext
methods.description:
Indicates whether there's another record, which could be read.
```ballerina
    # boolean hasNext = readableCSVChannel.hasNext();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: List of fields in the CSV or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: getNext
methods.description:
Gets the next record from the CSV file.
```ballerina
    # string[]|io:Error? record = readableCSVChannel.getNext();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Either a stream of records(string[]) or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: csvStream
methods.description:
Returns a CSV record stream that can be used to CSV records as a stream.
```ballerina
    # stream<string[], io:Error?>|io:Error? record = readableCSVChannel.csvStream();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given `CSVChannel`.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = readableCSVChannel.close();
    # ```

parameters.name: structType
parameters.description: The object in which the CSV records should be deserialized

parameters.name: fieldNames
parameters.description: The names of the fields used as the (composite)key of the table

returnParameters.description: Table, which represents the CSV records or else an `io:Error`

methods.name: getTable

classes.name: ReadableCSVChannel
classes.description: Represents a ReadableCSVChannel which could be used to read records from CSV file.

parameters.name: byteChannel
parameters.description: The channel, which would represent the source to read/write data

parameters.name: bOrder
parameters.description: network byte order

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the data channel.

returnParameters.description: The value of the integer, which is read or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readInt16
methods.description:
Reads a 16 bit integer.
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = dataChannel.readInt16();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The value of the integer, which is read or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readInt32
methods.description:
Reads a 32 bit integer.
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = dataChannel.readInt32();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The value of the integer, which is read or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readInt64
methods.description:
Reads a 64 bit integer.
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = dataChannel.readInt64();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The value of the float which is read or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readFloat32
methods.description:
Reads a 32 bit float.
```ballerina
    # float|io:Error result = dataChannel.readFloat32();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The value of the float which is read or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readFloat64
methods.description:
Reads a 64 bit float.
```ballerina
    # float|io:Error result = dataChannel.readFloat64();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: boolean value which is read or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readBool
methods.description:
Reads a byte and convert its value to boolean.
```ballerina
    # boolean|io:Error result = dataChannel.readBool();
    # ```

parameters.name: nBytes
parameters.description: Specifies the number of bytes, which represents the string

parameters.name: encoding
parameters.description: Specifies the char-set encoding of the string

returnParameters.description: The value of the string or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readString
methods.description:
Reads the string value represented through the provided number of bytes.
```ballerina
    # string|io:Error string = dataChannel.readString(10, "UTF-8");
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The value of the integer which is read or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: readVarInt
methods.description:
Reads a variable length integer.
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = dataChannel.readVarInt();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` if the channel is closed successfully or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes the data channel.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = dataChannel.close();
    # ```

classes.name: ReadableDataChannel
classes.description: Represents a data channel for reading data.

parameters.name: charChannel
parameters.description: CharacterChannel which will point to the input/output resource

parameters.name: fs
parameters.description: Field separator (this could be a regex)

parameters.name: rs
parameters.description: Record separator (this could be a regex)

methods.name: init
methods.description: Constructs a ReadableTextRecordChannel from a given ReadableCharacterChannel.

returnParameters.description: True if there's a record left to be read

methods.name: hasNext
methods.description:
Checks whether there's a record left to be read.
```ballerina
    # boolean hasNext = readableRecChannel.hasNext();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Set of fields included in the record or else `io:Error`

methods.name: getNext
methods.description:
Get the next record from the input/output resource.
```ballerina
    # string[]|io:Error record = readableRecChannel.getNext();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: An `io:Error` if the record channel could not be closed properly

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given record channel.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error err = readableRecChannel.close();
    # ```

parameters.name: charChannel
parameters.description: CharacterChannel which will point to the input/output resource

parameters.name: fs
parameters.description: Field separator (this could be a regex)

parameters.name: rs
parameters.description: Record separator (this could be a regex)

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Constructs a ReadableTextRecordChannel from a given ReadableCharacterChannel.

returnParameters.description: True if there's a record left to be read

otherMethods.name: hasNext
otherMethods.description:
Checks whether there's a record left to be read.
```ballerina
    # boolean hasNext = readableRecChannel.hasNext();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: Set of fields included in the record or else `io:Error`

otherMethods.name: getNext
otherMethods.description:
Get the next record from the input/output resource.
```ballerina
    # string[]|io:Error record = readableRecChannel.getNext();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: An `io:Error` if the record channel could not be closed properly

otherMethods.name: close
otherMethods.description:
Closes a given record channel.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error err = readableRecChannel.close();
    # ```

classes.name: StringReader
classes.description: Represents a reader which will wrap string content as a channel.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Block of bytes to be written

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the provided content, which needs to be kept when writing bytes

returnParameters.description: Number of bytes written or else `io:Error`

methods.name: write
methods.description:
Sinks bytes from a given input/output resource.

This is an asynchronous operation. The method might return before writing all the content.
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = writableByteChannel.write(record, 0);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `io:Error` or else `()`

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given byte channel.
After a channel is closed, any further writing operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error err = writableByteChannel.close();
    # ```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Block of bytes to be written

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset of the provided content, which needs to be kept when writing bytes

returnParameters.description: Number of bytes written or else `io:Error`

otherMethods.name: write
otherMethods.description:
Sinks bytes from a given input/output resource.

This is an asynchronous operation. The method might return before writing all the content.
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = writableByteChannel.write(record, 0);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `io:Error` or else `()`

otherMethods.name: close
otherMethods.description:
Closes a given byte channel.
After a channel is closed, any further writing operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error err = writableByteChannel.close();
    # ```

classes.name: WritableByteChannel
classes.description:
WritableByteChannel represents an output resource (i.e file) which could be used to sink bytes
A file path can be used to obtain a `io:WritableByteChannel`.
A `io:WritableByteChannel` can only be obtained using the following method or by providing a native implementation.
It cannot be instantiated.
`io:openWritableFile("./files/sample.txt")` - used to obtain a `io:WritableByteChannel` from a given file path

parameters.name: bChannel
parameters.description: The `WritableByteChannel`, which would be used to write the characters

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: The character set, which would be used to encode the given bytes to characters

methods.name: init
methods.description: Constructs a `WritableByteChannel` from a given `WritableByteChannel` and `Charset`.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written

parameters.name: startOffset
parameters.description: Number of characters to be offset when writing the content

returnParameters.description: Content length that written or else `io:Error`

methods.name: write
methods.description:
Writes a given sequence of characters (string).
```ballerina
    # int|io:Error result = writableCharChannel.write("Content", 0);
    # ```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content to be written

returnParameters.description: Returns null if the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

methods.name: writeLine
methods.description:
Writes a string as a line with a following newline character `\n`.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? result = writableCharChannel.writeLine("Content");
    # ```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The JSON to be written

returnParameters.description: Returns null if the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

methods.name: writeJson
methods.description:
Writes a given JSON to the given channel.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableCharChannel.writeJson(inputJson, 0);
    # ```

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: The XML to be written

returnParameters.description: `()` or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: writeXml
methods.description:
Writes a given XML to the channel.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableCharChannel.writeXml(inputXml, 0);
    # ```

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The map<string> that contains keys and values

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Comment describing the property list

returnParameters.description: `()` or else `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: writeProperties
methods.description:
Writes a given key-valued pair `map<string>` to a property file.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableCharChannel.writeProperties(properties);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given `WritableCharacterChannel` channel.
After a channel is closed, any further writing operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error err = writableCharChannel.close();
    # ```

classes.name: WritableDataChannel
classes.description: Represents a WritableDataChannel for writing data.

parameters.name: characterChannel
parameters.description: The `WritableCharacterChannel`, which will point to the input/output resource

parameters.name: fs
parameters.description: Field separator (this could be a regex)

parameters.name: rs
parameters.description: Record separator (this could be a regex)

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description:
The format, which will be used to represent the CSV (this could be 
        "DEFAULT" (the format specified by the CSVChannel), 
        "CSV" (Field separator would be "," and record separator would be a new line) or else
        "TDF" (Field separator will be a tab and record separator will be a new line).

methods.name: init
methods.description: Constructs a DelimitedTextRecordChannel from a given WritableCharacterChannel.

parameters.name: textRecord
parameters.description: List of fields to be written

returnParameters.description: An `io:Error` if the records could not be written properly or else `()`

methods.name: write
methods.description:
Writes records to a given output resource.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableChannel.write(records);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: An `io:Error` if the record channel could not be closed properly or else `()`

methods.name: close
methods.description:
Closes a given record channel.
After a channel is closed, any further writing operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableChannel.close();
    # ```

parameters.name: characterChannel
parameters.description: The `WritableCharacterChannel`, which will point to the input/output resource

parameters.name: fs
parameters.description: Field separator (this could be a regex)

parameters.name: rs
parameters.description: Record separator (this could be a regex)

parameters.name: fmt
parameters.description:
The format, which will be used to represent the CSV (this could be 
        "DEFAULT" (the format specified by the CSVChannel), 
        "CSV" (Field separator would be "," and record separator would be a new line) or else
        "TDF" (Field separator will be a tab and record separator will be a new line).

initMethod.name: init
initMethod.description: Constructs a DelimitedTextRecordChannel from a given WritableCharacterChannel.

parameters.name: textRecord
parameters.description: List of fields to be written

returnParameters.description: An `io:Error` if the records could not be written properly or else `()`

otherMethods.name: write
otherMethods.description:
Writes records to a given output resource.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableChannel.write(records);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: An `io:Error` if the record channel could not be closed properly or else `()`

otherMethods.name: close
otherMethods.description:
Closes a given record channel.
After a channel is closed, any further writing operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
    # io:Error? err = writableChannel.close();
    # ```

classes.name: WritableTextRecordChannel
classes.description: Represents a channel, which will allow to write records through a given WritableCharacterChannel.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Content, which should be exposed as a channel

returnParameters.description: The `ByteChannel` representation to read the memory content or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

functions.name: createReadableChannel
functions.description:
Creates an in-memory channel, which will be a reference stream of bytes.
```ballerina
# var byteChannel = io:createReadableChannel(content);
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: An optional size of the byte block. Default size is 4KB

returnParameters.description: Either a byte block stream or `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadBlocksAsStream
functions.description:
Read the entire file content as a stream of blocks.
```ballerina
# stream<io:Block, io:Error?>|io:Error content = io:fileReadBlocksAsStream("./resources/myfile.txt", 1000);
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

returnParameters.description: Either a read only byte array or `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadBytes
functions.description:
Read the entire file content as a byte array.
```ballerina
# byte[]|io:Error content = io:fileReadBytes("./resources/myfile.txt");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The CSV file path

parameters.name: skipHeaders
parameters.description: Number of headers, which should be skipped prior to reading records

returnParameters.description: The entire CSV content in the channel as an array of string arrays or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadCsv
functions.description:
Read file content as a CSV.
```ballerina
# string[][]|io:Error content = io:fileReadCsv("./resources/myfile.csv");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The CSV file path

returnParameters.description: The entire CSV content in the channel a stream of string arrays or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadCsvAsStream
functions.description:
Read file content as a CSV.
```ballerina
# stream<string[], io:Error?>|io:Error content = io:fileReadCsvAsStream("./resources/myfile.csv");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the JSON file

returnParameters.description: The file content as a JSON object or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadJson
functions.description:
Reads file content as a JSON.
```ballerina
# json|io:Error content = io:fileReadJson("./resources/myfile.json");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

returnParameters.description: The file as list of lines or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadLines
functions.description:
Reads the entire file content as a list of lines.
```ballerina
# string[]|io:Error content = io:fileReadLines("./resources/myfile.txt");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

returnParameters.description: The file content as a stream of strings or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadLinesAsStream
functions.description:
Reads file content as a stream of lines.
```ballerina
# stream<string, io:Error?>|io:Error content = io:fileReadLinesAsStream("./resources/myfile.txt");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

returnParameters.description: The entire file content as a string or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadString
functions.description:
Reads the entire file content as a `string`.
```ballerina
# string|io:Error content = io:fileReadString("./resources/myfile.txt");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the XML file

returnParameters.description: The file content as an XML or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileReadXml
functions.description:
Reads file content as an XML.
```ballerina
# xml|io:Error content = io:fileReadXml("./resources/myfile.xml");
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream to write

returnParameters.description: `io:Error` or else `()`

functions.name: fileWriteBlocksFromStream

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Byte content to write

returnParameters.description: `io:Error` or else `()`

functions.name: fileWriteBytes

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The CSV file path

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: CSV content as an array of string arrays

returnParameters.description: Either an `io:Error` or the null `()` value when the writing was successful

functions.name: fileWriteCsv

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The CSV file path

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: A CSV record stream to be written

returnParameters.description: Either an `io:Error` or the null `()` value when the writing was successful

functions.name: fileWriteCsvFromStream

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the JSON file

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: JSON content to write

returnParameters.description: The null `()` value when the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileWriteJson

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: An array of string lines to write

returnParameters.description: The null `()` value when the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileWriteLines

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: lineStream
parameters.description: A stream of lines to write

returnParameters.description: The null `()` value when the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileWriteLinesFromStream

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the file

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: String content to write

returnParameters.description: The null `()` value when the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileWriteString

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path of the XML file

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: XML content to write

returnParameters.description: The null `()` value when the writing was successful or an `io:Error`

functions.name: fileWriteXml

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: File path, which describes the location of the CSV

parameters.name: fieldSeparator
parameters.description: CSV record separator (i.e., comma or tab)

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: Representation of the encoding characters in the file

parameters.name: skipHeaders
parameters.description: Number of headers, which should be skipped

returnParameters.description: The `ReadableCSVChannel`, which could be used to iterate through the CSV records or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

functions.name: openReadableCsvFile
functions.description:
Retrieves a readable CSV channel from a given file path.
```ballerina
# io:ReadableCSVChannel rCsvChannel = check io:openReadableCsvFile(srcFileName);
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Relative/absolute path string to locate the file

returnParameters.description: The `ByteChannel` representation of the file resource or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

functions.name: openReadableFile
functions.description:
Retrieves a `ReadableByteChannel` from a given file path.
```ballerina
# io:ReadableByteChannel readableFieldResult = check io:openReadableFile("./files/sample.txt");
#```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: File path, which describes the location of the CSV

parameters.name: fieldSeparator
parameters.description: CSV record separator (i.e., comma or tab)

parameters.name: charset
parameters.description: Representation of the encoding characters in the file

parameters.name: skipHeaders
parameters.description: Number of headers, which should be skipped

returnParameters.description: The `WritableCSVChannel`, which could be used to write the CSV records or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

functions.name: openWritableCsvFile
functions.description:
Retrieves a writable CSV channel from a given file path.
```ballerina
# io:WritableCSVChannel wCsvChannel = check io:openWritableCsvFile(srcFileName);
# ```

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Relative/absolute path string to locate the file

parameters.name: append
parameters.description: Whether to append to the end of file

returnParameters.description: The `ByteChannel` representation of the file resource or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

functions.name: openWritableFile
functions.description:
Retrieves a `WritableByteChannel` from a given file path.
```ballerina
# io:WritableByteChannel writableFileResult = check io:openWritableFile("./files/sampleResponse.txt");
# ```

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: The value(s) to be printed

functions.name: print
functions.description:
Prints `any` or `error` value(s) to the STDOUT.
```ballerina
#io:print("Start processing the CSV file from ", srcFileName);
#```

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: The value(s) to be printed

functions.name: println
functions.description:
Prints `any` or `error` value(s) to the STDOUT followed by a new line.
```ballerina
#io:println("Start processing the CSV file from ", srcFileName);
#```

parameters.name: a
parameters.description: Any value to be printed

returnParameters.description: Input read from the STDIN

functions.name: readln
functions.description:
Retrieves the input read from the STDIN.
```ballerina
# string choice = io:readln("Enter choice 1 - 5: ");
# ```

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The string needs to be formatted

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Arguments referred by the format specifiers in the format string

returnParameters.description: The formatted string

functions.name: sprintf

constants.name: BIG_ENDIAN
constants.description: Specifies the bytes to be in the order of most significant byte first.

constants.name: COLON
constants.description: Colon (:) will be use as the field separator.

constants.name: COMMA
constants.description: Comma (,) will be used as the field separator.

constants.name: CSV
constants.description: Field separator will be "," and the record separator will be a new line.

constants.name: CSV_RECORD_SEPARATOR
constants.description: Represents the record separator of the CSV file.

constants.name: DEFAULT
constants.description: Default value is the format specified by the CSVChannel. Precedence will be given to the field separator and record separator.

constants.name: DEFAULT_ENCODING
constants.description: Default encoding for the abstract read/write APIs.

constants.name: FS_COLON
constants.description: Represents the colon separator, which should be used to identify colon-separated files.

constants.name: LITTLE_ENDIAN
constants.description: Specifies the byte order to be the least significant byte first.

constants.name: MINIMUM_HEADER_COUNT
constants.description: Represents the minimum number of headers, which will be included in the CSV.

constants.name: TAB
constants.description: Tab (/t) will be use as the field separator.

constants.name: TDF
constants.description: Field separator will be a tab and the record separator will be a new line.

errors.name: AccessDeniedError
errors.description: This will get returned due to file permission issues.

errors.name: ConnectionTimedOutError
errors.description: This will return when connection timed out happen when try to connect to a remote host.

errors.name: EofError
errors.description: This will get returned if read operations are performed on a channel after it closed.

errors.name: FileNotFoundError
errors.description: This will get returned if the file is not available in the given file path.

errors.name: GenericError
errors.description: Represents generic IO error. The detail record contains the information related to the error.

errors.name: TypeMismatchError
errors.description: This will get returned when there is an mismatch of given type and the expected type.

types.name: ByteOrder
types.description:
Represents network byte order.

BIG_ENDIAN - specifies the bytes to be in the order of most significant byte first.

LITTLE_ENDIAN - specifies the byte order to be the least significant byte first.

types.name: Format
types.description:
The format, which will be used to represent the CSV.

DEFAULT - The default value is the format specified by the CSVChannel. Precedence will be given to the field
          separator and record separator.

CSV - Field separator will be "," and the record separator will be a new line.

TDF - Field separator will be a tab and record separator will be a new line.

types.name: Separator
types.description:
Field separators, which are supported by the `DelimitedTextRecordChannel`.

COMMA - Delimited text records will be separated using a comma

TAB - Delimited text records will be separated using a tab

COLON - Delimited text records will be separated using a colon(:)
